articles.title: Vietnam starts mass evacuations, shuts airports as Typhoon Kajiki approaches
articles.description: Vietnam has shut down airports, closed schools, and initiated mass evacuations as it prepares for the most powerful storm so far this year. Typhoon Kajiki was packing winds of up to 166 kph (103 mph) as it approached Vietnam's central coast and was forecast to grow stronger before making landfall on Monday afternoon, the country's weather agency said.

articles.title: Multiple journalists killed by Israeli strikes on Gaza hospital
articles.description: Four journalists were among at least eight people killed on Monday (August 25, 2025) in a strike on a hospital in southern Gaza, including a freelancer who worked for the Associated Press. Mariam Dagga, 33, freelanced for the AP since the Gaza war began, as well as other news outlets.

articles.title: Wildfires threaten homes in Oregon and California, prompting hundreds of evacuations
articles.description: Wildfires threaten homes in Oregon and California, prompting hundreds of evacuations. The so-called picket fire is roaring through Northern California's wine country scorching more than 6,500 acres the flames casting an orange smoky hue over the skies. As more people have been forced to leave their homes in central Oregon the flat fire exploding in size overnight burning more than 21,000 acres thousands of homes there threatened the heat bearing down on the West.
articles.source: ABC World News Tonight with David Muir
